articles.title: 分析：清洁能源2025年为中国GDP增长贡献超过三分之一
articles.summary: 2025年，太阳能、电动汽车及其他清洁能源技术对中国经济增长的贡献已超过三分之一，并拉动超过九成的投资增长。 中国清洁能源行业产值在2025年达到创纪录的15.4万亿元人民币（约合2.1万亿美元），约占国内生产总值（GDP）的11.4%，该数字相当于巴西或加拿大的经济规模。 Carbon Brief基于官方数字、行业数据及分析师报告进行的最新分析显示，2022年至2025年间，中国清洁能源行业的实际规模几乎翻了一番；若将其视为一个独立经济体，其规模可位列全球第八。 该分析的其他主要成果包括： 这些投向清洁能源制造业的资金，代表着对中国乃至全球能源转型的重大押注，也为政府和企业保持这一发展势头提供了动力。 然而，未来的长期走势仍然存在不确定性，尤其是在太阳能领域。受136号文件下的新定价机制影响，太阳能发电装机增速已有所放缓，而中央政府设定的相关目标也明显低于近几年的实际扩张水平。 如果放缓趋势持续下去，这些产业或将从经济增长的驱动力转变为拖累因素，同时加剧工业领域的“产能过剩”问题，并进一步恶化国际贸易摩擦。 但即便中央政府对清洁能源未来五年的目标设定较为谨慎，地方政府和国有企业的规划

articles.summary: Anthropic’s new AI tool plugins are aimed at automating tasks across legal, sales, marketing and data analysis functions, intensifying fears of disruption across the software ecosystem. It has triggered a steep sell-off in software and legal companies' shares.

articles.summary: Amazon India is partnering with IIT Roorkee to create new packaging materials. These will be made from agricultural waste, offering a sustainable alternative to wood pulp and plastic. The project aims to develop lightweight, strong, and compostable mailers. This initiative could also benefit farmers by creating a market for their crop residues.

articles.summary: India's economy is set for a boost as the US lowers tariffs on Indian goods. This move is expected to increase India's GDP by 20-30 basis points next fiscal year. Key sectors like gems and jewellery, textiles, and marine products will see improved exports. The rupee is also likely to stabilize with increased foreign investment.

articles.summary: OpenAI is developing a social platform using biometric verification like Apple Face ID and World Orb to block bots, competing with Meta's Threads and Bluesky amid privacy concerns.

articles.title: India likely to restrict duty-free imports of soybean, corn for human consumption under its US trade deal
articles.summary: India plans to limit duty-free imports of soybean and corn for human consumption in its trade deal with the US. The agreement may allow some American farm products for energy and animal feed. India is also considering market access for American sorghum and distillers-dried grains. However, Indian consumers will likely see duty-free access for American nuts like almonds and walnuts.

articles.summary: India’s GCCs continue to grow, with Bengaluru, Hyderabad, and Delhi NCR attracting premium office and residential investments. Expansion is also reaching tier II and III cities, driven by lower costs and better quality of life for employees. However, talent scarcity, AI adoption gaps, and cyber risks remain key challenges for sustained growth.

articles.title: Trouble brewing in machines for coffee chains?
articles.summary: Companies will now have to pay a 10% customs duty on machines which are largely imported from parts of Europe (primarily Italy, Spain and Romania for roasting and brewing machines) and China (for vending machines), industry executives said. The cost of machines vary depending on the model and the region of sourcing and therefore firms tend to have varied cost structures.

articles.title: US-India trade deal: Rice output to prop up export dreams
articles.summary: India's record rice harvest is set to boost exports to the United States. A US duty cut will make Indian rice more competitive against rivals. This agreement also helps revive basmati rice exports to Iran. Lower tariffs will ease costs and improve pricing for Indian rice. This trade deal strengthens exports of high-value farm products. Farmers will see better outcomes.

articles.title: 11:11 | Jefferies' rejig, Anthropic induces panic, IndiGo's falling market share and more
articles.summary: In today's newsletter, we take a look at Jefferies' Chris Wood's removal of exposure from ICICI bank, DLF, IndiGo's declining share in the Indian aviation market amid controversies, Silver's recovery after the crash and more, only with the CNBC-TV18 Newsletter.

articles.title: Uber misses on profit outlook, names new CFO for robotaxi future
articles.summary: The executive, Balaji Krishnamurthy, has been with Uber for more than six years and is currently vice president of strategic finance and investor relations. He will replace current CFO Prashanth Mahendra-Rajah, who is leaving for another opportunity after less than three years at the company, according to a regulatory filing published Wednesday. The outgoing CFO will step down from his post on Feb. 16 and stay on as a senior finance adviser through July 1, the filing said.

articles.title: Are they human? Revanth Reddy claims BRS listened in on husband-wife calls
articles.summary: Are they human? Revanth Reddy claims BRS listened in on husband-wife calls

articles.title: On US India deal, Goyal says energy diversification paramount for India
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal stressed energy diversification and security for India, while US-India talks hint at expanding trade and reducing Russian oil reliance, but no formal commitments were announced.

articles.title: ChatGPT back up after a brief outage, Downdetector shows
articles.summary: At the peak of the disruption, more than 13,000 users reported problems with ​the chatbot, ​before reports fell to ‌309 as ‍of 4:33 ‍p.m. ET, Downdetector data showed. ‌The site tracks outages by aggregating user-submitted reports from multiple sources.

articles.title: Why gold’s recent fall may be short-lived, explains SAMCO
articles.summary: Long-term uptrend remains intact, supported by central bank buying and geopolitical risks.

articles.title: UNICEF calls for criminalisation of AI content depicting child sex abuse
articles.summary: The United Nations children's agency UNICEF on Wednesday called for countries to criminalize the creation of AI-generated child sexual abuse content, ‌saying it was ‌alarmed by reports of an increase in the number of artificial intelligence images sexualising children.

articles.title: Skyways Air Services files draft papers with SEBI for IPO
articles.summary: The IPO is a mix of fresh issue of up to 3.292 crore equity shares and an offer for sale up to 1.333 crore equity shares by promoters and other selling shareholders.

articles.title: US tariff cut to boost India's medical devices exports
articles.summary: India's medical device exports are set for a major boost. The US has reduced tariffs on Indian goods significantly. This move makes Indian products more competitive against Chinese suppliers. It also opens up new opportunities in the US market. Industry leaders are calling this a transformative development for domestic manufacturers. This will enhance global competitiveness and spur investments.

articles.title: 15 minutes to PM's speech, Lok Sabha slid into chaos: A firsthand account
articles.summary: 15 minutes to PM's speech, Lok Sabha slid into chaos: A firsthand account

articles.title: Tether retreats from $20 billon funding ambitions after investor pushback: Report
articles.summary: Tether's advisers have floated raising ‌as little ‌as $5 billion after facing investor reluctance, the report said, citing people familiar with the ‌matter, following talks of a $15 billion to $20 billion fundraise last year.

articles.title: Sony hikes guidance on strong games, music performance
articles.summary: Japanese giant Sony on Thursday hiked its full-year net profit forecast thanks to strong performances in its video games and music divisions. The firm expects net profit of 1.13 trillion yen ($7.2 billion) in the 2025-26 fiscal year, up from its previous projection of 1.05 trillion yen given in November, it said in a statement.

articles.title: Instagram recovers after brief outage disrupts US users
articles.summary: There ​were ​10,108 incidents of ‌people ‍reporting ‍issues with the social media ‌platform as of 8.30 p.m. ET, according to Downdetector, ‍which tracks outages by ‍collating ⁠status ⁠reports from a number of sources.

articles.title: TSMC fabricated seven chips, including 12nm under DLI
articles.summary: Seven chip designs made by startups under the design-linked incentive (DLI) scheme for semiconductors have been successfully fabricated, including advanced nodes such as 12 nanometres (nm) by global majors like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co, the government told the Lok Sabha Wednesday.

articles.title: AMD falls as dour forecast shows tough competition in AI trade
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices shares sank 13% on Wednesday after ‍the company's lackluster sales forecast deepened investor ​doubts about its ability to take on AI chip bellwether Nvidia.

articles.title: Amazon plans to use AI to speed up TV and film production
articles.summary: At the Amazon MGM Studio, veteran entertainment executive ⁠Albert Cheng is leading a team charged with developing new AI tools that he said will cut costs and streamline the creative process. Amazon plans to launch a closed beta program in March, inviting industry partners to test its AI tools. The company expects to have results to share by May.

articles.title: Odisha hosts Black Swan summit to boost AI-led digital growth
articles.summary: Bhubaneswar is set to host the Black Swan Summit India, a significant two-day conference on AI, FinTech, and InsurTech. President Droupadi Murmu and Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi will attend the event. The summit aims to position Odisha as a key player in India's digital growth.

articles.title: Private funds assess AI better than public investors: Fractal Analytics CEO on discounted IPO pricing
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics, which is expected to be the first pureplay Indian artificial intelligence (AI) company to tap the country’s public markets, has priced its initial public offering (IPO) at about a 26% discount to its most recent private market valuation.

articles.title: Partners earn on par with IT freshers, top performers make over Rs 51,000 a month: Urban Company
articles.summary: Urban Company said its service partners earned higher average monthly incomes this year compared to last, despite growing unrest in the gig economy. The company highlighted steady demand, insurance cover, and pension access as signs of improved work conditions. The data contrasts with recent strikes demanding better pay and worker recognition.

articles.title: Taiwan's MediaTek flags supply chain crunch from AI, says will adjust prices
articles.summary: Taiwanese tech companies like MediaTek and TSMC, the world's largest contract chipmaker, have reported surging business thanks to the AI boom.

articles.title: AMD shares fall as data-center sales boom remains months away
articles.summary: Excluding the surprise AI chip sales to China, the company's data-center segment would have missed estimates at a time when longtime rival Nvidia has accustomed investors to blowout forecasts. On a conference call with investors, AMD CEO Lisa Su reiterated that the company expects sales of a new flagship AI server to OpenAI and others to rise rapidly ‌in the second half of this ‌year, saying a global memory-chip crunch will not slow its plans.

articles.title: India-US trade breakthrough brings relief for electronics exports, spurs $100 billion ambition
articles.summary: The India-US trade deal may help drive bilateral electronics and semiconductor trade towards $100 billion and provide clarity to businesses even as concerns still linger over potential tariff risks linked to US Section 232 investigations, industry bodies and companies told ET.

articles.title: Disagreement over economics behind latest Peak XV high-profile MD exits: Shailendra Singh
articles.summary: The three senior-level departures of Ashish Agrawal, Ishaan Mittal, and Tejeshwi Sharma at Peak XV Partners have come against the backdrop of disagreements over economics and payouts, the venture capital (VC) firm’s managing director Shailendra Singh told ET in an interaction.

articles.title: Fractal Analytics shrinks IPO size to Rs 2,834 crore
articles.summary: Fractal Analytics has trimmed its IPO to Rs 2,833.9 crore, down 42% from the initial Rs 4,900 crore, with listing planned for February 16. The offer includes Rs 1,023.5 crore of fresh shares and Rs 1,810.4 crore for sale. The bid will run from February 9 to 11 .

articles.title: Apple sets up first Education Hub in India in Bengaluru
articles.summary: Apple has set up an education hub in Bengaluru – its first in India and fourth globally – to offer skill-building and training programmes as well as its suite of development courses to its suppliers’ employees.

articles.title: Walmart hits $1 trillion market value, joins club dominated by Big Tech giants
articles.summary: Walmart became the first retailer ever to hit $1 trillion in market valuation on Tuesday, riding on a year-long rally that has seen its shares rise nearly 26%, placing it among the ranks of Big Tech heavyweights such as Nvidia and Alphabet.

articles.title: 'Did titles ever matter at Eternal? I am still very much here': Deepinder Goyal on stepping down as CEO
articles.summary: The Eternal founder and former CEO wrote this post in an effort to hire former employees of Zomato who may have quit or been laid off by the company. Expressing his desire to have them back, he said the company has become ‘more organised and a little less chaotic.’ Earlier in a podcast, he had said that the company has several employees who have returned and taken up different roles from their previous ones.

articles.title: Strong demand lifts services PMI in Jan
articles.summary: India's services sector showed strong growth in January. New orders and output increased, boosting activity. Manufacturing also saw gains. This positive trend signals sustained momentum. Businesses are optimistic about the future. Hiring resumed, though at a modest pace. Input and output prices rose moderately. Service providers are managing costs effectively.

articles.title: Kremlin shrugs off India’s oil diversification move
articles.summary: India plans to diversify its energy sources to ensure citizen security. Russia's Kremlin stated this is not new, as India has always sourced oil from various nations, including Russia. This comes after a US-India trade deal announcement. Russia acknowledges India's established practice of buying oil from multiple international suppliers.

articles.title: Trade deal with US aligns with India's manufacturing ambitions, report shows
articles.summary: A new India-US trade deal is set to boost India's manufacturing and exports. This agreement helps India diversify its trade and climb global value chains. For the US, India offers a large market and manufacturing options. The deal is expected to improve India's growth and financial stability. Export-focused sectors will benefit from better market access and certainty.

articles.title: India services activity ticks up in January, PMI shows
articles.summary: India's services sector showed strong recovery in January. New business surged, reaching its fastest pace since November. This growth was fueled by enhanced online presence and marketing efforts. International demand also contributed significantly. However, job creation remained nearly unchanged. Input costs increased, leading to higher service charges. Business confidence for the future is on the rise.

articles.title: Gold and silver get cheaper to import as government cuts base prices
articles.summary: Gold and silver import prices have been reduced by India's government. This action lowers the customs duty on these precious metals. The move comes as global prices for gold and silver are near record highs. India is a major consumer of gold and the largest market for silver. The government typically revises these prices every two weeks.

articles.title: Seafood exporters hooking in US buyers after months of stalled orders
articles.summary: Indian exporters are seeing a surge in activity. Orders are resuming and negotiations are back on track with American buyers. This follows a period of stalled business. The textile, apparel, and seafood sectors are all experiencing renewed optimism. Exporters are planning trips and restarting production. This marks a significant turnaround for Indian trade with the US.

articles.title: India-US trade deal: Textile, jewellery, engg companies expect order book to swell
articles.summary: Indian exporters expect a 20% rise in overseas shipments over the next five to six years. This growth is driven by a US tariff cut on Indian goods, boosting competitiveness for apparel, home textiles, and engineering products. Rice exports will also benefit, allowing India to expand its market share. The gem and jewellery sector also anticipates relief and increased orders.

articles.title: India-China bilateral trade reached $155 billion in 2025: Envoy
articles.summary: India and China's trade reached a record USD 155 billion in 2025, growing over 12 percent. This marks a significant improvement in bilateral ties following a military stand-off. The Chinese ambassador highlighted cooperation and shared cultural values. Both nations are committed to strengthening multilateral coordination and advancing the development of the Global South.

articles.title: Funny but dishonest: Sam Altman blasts Anthropic’s ChatGPT Superbowl ad jab
articles.summary: Altman took aim at Anthropic’s national campaign, which shows a generic AI chatbot interrupting users with intrusive product advertisements. The video ends with the tagline: “Ads are coming to AI. But not to Claude.” — a reference to Anthropic’s chatbot, Claude.

articles.title: As software stocks slump, investors debate AI's existential threat
articles.summary: Investors were assessing on Wednesday whether a selloff in global software ⁠stocks this week had gone too far, as they weighed if businesses could survive an existential threat posed by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Roblox launches AI tech that generates functioning models with natural language
articles.summary: Roblox launched an artificial intelligence technology on Wednesday that ‍can generate fully functioning in-game ​models using natural language prompts, as the company aggressively ⁠pursues machine learning to attract more developers to its videogame platform.

articles.title: ElevenLabs raises $500 million in round led by Sequoia; valuation jumps fourfold to $11 billion
articles.summary: While existing investors Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) and ICONIQ increased their investments by four and three times, respectively, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Evantic Capital, and BOND came in as the startup’s new backers. With this, ElevenLabs has raised $781 million since its founding in 2022. The fresh funds will be used for the development of its agentic AI platform, ElevenAgents, for enterprises.

articles.title: Martech startup Fibr AI raises $5.7 million seed round led by Accel
articles.summary: Martech startup Fibr AI has raised $5.7 million in a seed round led by Accel, following its $1.8 million pre-seed in 2024. Founded in 2023 by Ankur Goyal and Pritam Roy, the company builds an agentic web experience layer that turns static websites into adaptive, self-optimising systems. Its platform helps enterprises personalise experiences for both humans visitors and AI-driven systems.

articles.title: Indian IT's Anthropic bloodbath; Fractal CEO interview
articles.summary: IT stocks fall amid fears that new AI tools from Anthropic could threaten jobs. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: How international students can work in Australia after they graduate
articles.summary: International students in Australia can pursue careers with the Temporary Graduate visa. This visa allows graduates to work and gain experience after completing their studies. It offers a bridge between student life and professional opportunities. Various streams cater to different qualifications. Graduates can explore long-term visa options and build valuable local experience.

articles.title: Asian equities decline post tech selloff, gold rises
articles.summary: The MSCI Asia Pacific Index declined 0.3% during the open. South Korea's Kospi Index led losses, declining 1.6%.

articles.title: Federal Court sentences Trump assassination attempt convict to life behind bars
articles.summary: Ryan Routh, convicted of plotting to assassinate Donald Trump during a 2024 golf outing in Florida, has been sentenced to life in prison after prosecutors argued he showed no remorse and posed an ongoing threat. The case highlighted serious security risks around major political figures, with the Secret Service intervening before any shots were fired.

articles.title: Sharad Pawar holds two meetings with late Ajit Pawar's sons
articles.summary: Sharad Pawar met Parth and Jay Pawar in Baramati to discuss Vidya Pratishthan projects and possible NCP merger ahead of Zila Parishad polls. Ajit Pawar memorial was not discussed.

articles.title: Trump says he discussed Iran with China's Xi as US pushes Beijing, others to isolate Tehran
articles.summary: Trump said the two leaders also discussed a broad range of other critical issues in the US-China relationship, including trade and Taiwan and his plans to visit Beijing in April.

articles.title: Tanker Crash | Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic chaos continues, tolls halted
articles.summary: Toll collection on Mumbai–Pune Expressway was suspended after a propylene gas tanker overturned near Adoshi tunnel yesterday (Feb 3) evening, causing a 12-hour traffic halt and major disruption in Raigad district.

articles.title: S&P Global-HSBC PMI: India’s services activity rebounds in January, jobs growth nearly flat
articles.summary: Rise in new export businesses helped push the growth with demands increasing from Indonesia, Qatar, Sri Lanka and Vietnam. As a result, the numbers expanded fastest since November.

articles.title: India-US trade deal lifts market mood, industry sees relief for key export sectors
articles.summary: Industry leaders Rajiv Memani, Amit Kalyani, Sanjay Budhia and Suvankar Sen welcome the India-US trade deal, citing tariff relief and improved export prospects.

articles.title: Impact of AI on jobs is still unfolding, says CEA; assures of markets turnaround
articles.summary: Post-Budget 2026 | Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran said the labour market impact of AI is still at an early stage in India and globally; potential disruptions being addressed by focusing on skilling initiatives and jobs in sectors less likely to be affected by AI, such as allied healthcare economy, tourism, and the orange economy; cautioning that incentives alone cannot drive private capex and that the current state of global funk may continue for a few more years.

articles.title: CEA Nageswaran: India growth story intact despite valuation worries, global uncertainty
articles.summary: Chief Economic Adviser told CNBC-TV18 that FII outflows, US policy uncertainty and sector issues weigh on markets, but India’s growth story and fundamentals remain strong despite volatility.

articles.title: Disinvestment mojo intact, ₹80,000 cr not scary, says DIPAM secy; more OFSs, QIPs ahead
articles.summary: The government has not lost its disinvestment momentum, is confident of meeting the ₹80,000-crore target, and expects more PSU OFSs and QIPs in FY26 and FY27, DIPAM Secretary Arunish Chawla said in conversation with CNBC-TV18 at a post-Budget event.

articles.title: Ridham Desai sees biggest macro-market gap in decades in India, valuations at rare discount
articles.summary: Ridham Desai, Managing Director and Chief Equity Strategist (India) at Morgan Stanley, believes the market has underestimated India's strong macroeconomic fundamentals, creating a major disconnect. He lauded the Union Budget for its strategic push into Artificial Intelligence (AI), positioning India as the 'next big AI trade' through incentives for data centers and leveraging the nation's skilled workforce.

articles.title: India's Manufactuing PMI expands to 55.4 in January
articles.summary: In Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) parlance, a print above 50 means expansion while a score below 50 denotes contraction.

articles.title: Global equity correction risk rising, India may outperform: S Naren
articles.summary: S Naren, Executive Director and Chief Investment Officer at ICICI Prudential AMC advises investors to focus on asset allocation, citing expensive valuations across markets. articles.title: AI is the new oil: Nations, not companies, are racing for global dominance
